author: Odeinoichus
title: A Bumblebee needs help to fly? Not entirely.
review:
Set #41234 Bumblebee Helicopter: LEGO introduced a new Mini-Doll Theme in 2017 and that new theme is the DC Super Hero Girls. Another DC based Theme, we’ve got LEGO Batman, LEGO DC Super Heroes, LEGO DC Super Hero Girls and The LEGO Batman Movie, Warner Brothers has a fairly good report with LEGO it would seem.

This set is one of the cheapest and offers a unique mini-doll character, a fun looking vehicle and some enemies for her to protect others from. Overall this review will cover the set from the perspective of someone who hasn’t followed along with this new interpretation of the female heroines of DC Comics.

Box/Instructions

Box: A lighter blue colouring is used for the box designs of this Theme, DC Super Hero Girls is prominently displayed on the front of the box and the images on the front and back showcase the set in fun action scenes and what features are included. Overall a decent looking box design that stands out next to LEGO Friends, Elves and Disney theme boxes in the girl’s LEGO aisle.

Instructions: These share design elements from the LEGO Friends, Elves and Disney Princess themes. The colouring is unique to the DC Super Hero Girls sets, however the overall design is the same with mini-dolls being pictured to show off the set and the cross-promotional image design is a checklist design similar to the other themes mentioned. They’re easy to follow along with too.

Parts

There’s some interesting elements in this set, the cockpit bubble isn’t new, the other elements aren’t too new either, however the colours are new, this is the first time we’ve seen the cheese slopes in clear red. The same goes for the LEGO crystal element.

Mini-Doll

Bumblebee: This is a character I’m only partially familiar with thanks to the Teen Titans cartoon. Her mini-doll looks very nice, she features a unique new hair piece with some yellow print for a hair clip or something, a new pair of translucent wings made out of the same material as the Geonosian wings found in LEGO Star Wars, which fits over the neck and torso connectors.

She also features some nice printing on her top which is a yellow outfit with honeycomb patterns and a sort of metallic black finish, which matches the colour of her legs. She uses the pants leg piece which features minor printing for costume details on her ankles.

She’s just a great new dynamic looking Mini-Doll that will look great in anyone’s collection.

Kryptomites: These little pests are built with primarily red and clear red pieces, each one features the exact same facial print, one has large red crystal elements on the top while the other does not. These little brick-built creatures are pretty fun actually and I love the creative design aesthetic used by LEGO to capture the likeness of these kryptonite inspired creatures.

The build

Basically you’re building up a helicopter with this set, a very unique and fun looking helicopter, there’s an extra small model however this is relatively quick to build and not much to discuss here, we’ll save that for the model section of the review.

The helicopter itself is very cute in design, it looks squat and small and something that could easily zip in and out against enemy actions. Definitely something the character of Bumblebee would pilot, and the build is very sturdy, it’s all compacted quite nicely for smaller hands to construct.

The completed model

Bumblebee Helicopter: As I noted during the build section this is a very compacted looking model. Bumblebee fits inside quite nicely and her wings don’t get creased or bent out of shape. Two stud launchers are on the front to protect the helicopter from Kryptomite attackers.

In the back you store kryptonite crystals, apparently the Super Hero Girls are trying to keep this out of the hands of Lena Luthor. Honestly I don’t know much about the story. What I do know is this is a very fun little model.

Kryptomite Generator: This is basically a rectangular box that apparently is how the Kryptomites are created. It’s a fun little box that can open and close. It should be noted that for both models stickers are used for the detailing.

Overall opinion

I have never had anything against the Mini-Doll themes of LEGO and each new Theme that LEGO introduces to this scale is loaded with fun elements. This particular set is a great addition to any fan’s collection and features a unique looking helicopter that would fit in perfectly with Heartlake City if you wanted to mix and match.

I’d strongly recommend this set because of the fun aspect and the unique elements, including the brand new hair piece that is unique to Bumblebee. Definitely a set worth picking up.
